intro: Cyrtandra honomanuensis, commonly known as the Maui Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, berry-like fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
